Episodes.Title: The War Against Drugs
Episodes.Plot: Brian Lane enters rehab to treat his alcoholism, but the rest of the team soon join him.

Episodes.Title: The Truth Is Out There
Episodes.Plot: The team finds itself at the centre of a shocking cover-up.
Episodes.GuestStars: Glynis Barber, Raquel Cassidy, Mark Williams, Mark Rice-Oxley, Michael Landes, Michael Brandon, Alexandra Boyd

Episodes.Title: Fresh Starts
Episodes.Plot: The team exhumes the body of a car crash victim after claims she has been seen alive.

Episodes.Title: Shadow Show
Episodes.Plot: UCOS are forced to re-open the investigation into producer Max Stone's death.
Episodes.GuestStars: Hannah Waterman, Anthony Calf, Emily Tierney, Stanley Townsend, Imogen Stubbs,Heidi Monsen, Sandra Dickinson, Kenny Doughty

Episodes.Title: Death of a Timeshare Salesman
Episodes.Plot: The UCOS team find themselves reinvestigating the death of a well-known timeshare magnate.

Episodes.Title: The Last Laugh
Episodes.Plot: The team reinvestigate the disappearance of two young political activists.
Episodes.GuestStars: Phil Daniels, Jon Henshaw, David Troughton, Joe Absolom

Episodes.Title: Blood Is Thicker Than Water
Episodes.Plot:
UCOS reinvestigate a high-profile riverboat disaster on the Thames after a new witness comes forward claiming the collision was the result of sabotage, rather than an accident.
But the case means putting DAC Strickland's wealthy sailing chums under the investigation spotlight; what better motivation could the team have?

Episodes.Title: Meat Is Murder
Episodes.Plot: As the series comes to an end, the desiccated, neatly carved-up body of a butcher who disappeared more than 30 years ago is discovered, leading Sandra Pullman and her boys to pay a visit to Smithfield meat market in London, the original murder scene. It's a pity the butcher is dead, because he has a few questions to answer about why the body of a doctor was found hanging from a meat hook all those years ago at the back of his market stall. It's an episode peppered with revelations. We discover G
